meanings.definition: Enzymes that break down phosphodiester bonds in nucleic acids.
meanings.sent1: Phosphodiesterases are important enzymes in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phosphodiesterases to understand how DNA is regulated.
meanings.sent3: The phosphodiesterases at the DNA party were the life of the cell!
meanings.sent4: In the story of genetics, phosphodiesterases are the silent heroes breaking down barriers.
meanings.sent5: The classroom model of DNA replication included tiny phosphodiesterases working diligently.

meanings.definition: Drugs that inhibit the action of phosphodiesterases, used to treat various medical conditions.
meanings.sent1: Doctors prescribe phosphodiesterases to help patients with heart problems.
meanings.sent2: Phosphodiesterases can be a crucial part of medical treatments.
meanings.sent3: The patient joked that the phosphodiesterases were the 'party poopers' in his body.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, phosphodiesterases are the warriors fighting for health.
meanings.sent5: The image of phosphodiesterases as tiny soldiers in the bloodstream stuck with the students.
